Rule.NonCompliantComment: MariaDB is not running the latest security patches, which may expose it to vulnerabilities.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Regularly update MariaDB to the latest security-patched version.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Example or test databases are installed on the production server, increasing security risks.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Remove all example or test databases from the production server.
Rule.Correction: mysql -u root -p -e "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS test;"
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW DATABASES;" | grep -q 'test' && echo 1 || echo 0

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'allow-suspicious-udfs' parameter is enabled, which may allow unsafe user-defined functions (UDFs).
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set 'allow-suspicious-udfs' to 'OFF' to prevent unsafe UDFs.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'allow_suspicious_udfs';" | grep -q 'OFF' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'local_infile' parameter is enabled, which may allow unauthorized file imports.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Disable 'local_infile' to prevent unauthorized file imports.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'local_infile';" | grep -q 'OFF' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: MariaDB is started with 'skip-grant-tables', which disables access control and authentication.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'skip-grant-tables' is not used during startup.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Symbolic links are enabled, which may allow unauthorized file access.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'have_symlink';" | grep -q 'DISABLED' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'secure_file_priv' parameter is not set, which may allow unrestricted file access.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'secure_file_priv';" | grep -q '/var/lib/mysql-files' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'sql_mode' parameter does not contain 'STRICT_ALL_TABLES', which may allow invalid data entries.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'sql_mode' includes 'STRICT_ALL_TABLES' for strict data integrity.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'sql_mode';" | grep -q 'STRICT_ALL_TABLES' && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Data-at-rest encryption is not enabled, which may expose sensitive data.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable data-at-rest encryption for sensitive data.
Rule.Verification: mysql -u root -p -e "SHOW VARIABLES LIKE 'innodb_encrypt_tables';" | grep -q 'ON' && echo 0 || echo 1
